label: Home Battery Start v4.4.2
info:
# Home battery control
Consists of three flows:
 1.  Start flow
 1.  Control flow
 1.  Master switch flow

## Start flow
This is the starting point of your home battery control.

It starts with P1 measurement as a trigger.
It allows you to connect your battery sensors to the flow.
It ends with a function node, mapping your batteries to a battery_array

The battery_array is passed on to the control flow.

When the control flow has calculated the desired corrections,
it is passed back to this flow and applied to your batteries.

label: Strategy Dynamic v4.4.2
info: Dynamic contract automated management

Home Battery Strategy
info:
The `Home Battery Start` flow will call this strategy flow
by matching the strategy name with the Link In name.

Configure the Link In node in the Start group.

Don't modify other parts of the Start and End groups.
They handle the calling and returning for you.

name: Start (readme)
info:
# Setting up your battery strategy flow

## Setup
Name the `Link In node` in this start group exactly after the <select> option configured in your
select_input.house_battery_strategy

configure select options in:
input_select_house_battery_control.yaml

### example
`house_battery_strategy:
  name: House Battery Strategy
  options:
    - AcmE example`

The above creates a select option, allowing user to select 'AcmE example'

When selected, battery control will search for a flow containing a Link In node
called 'AcmE example' (case sensitive).

name: End (readme)
info:
Should return a solution_array of battery objects

## battery object format
`{{id: string|number, mode: string, power: number}} battery solution`
- id is an arbitrary battery ID
- mode is "stop", "charge", "discharge" for Marstek
- power in Watts

### example array
return this type of solution_array via msg.solutions
` 
let solution_array = [];
solution_array.push({id:"M1", mode: "charge", power: 100}); // per battery
return {solutions: solution_array};
`

name: Selected
Unhandled Exception
Cache data source
Cheapest Energy Hours - errors
info:
"No valid sensor found" if price_data is none and not valid_sensor,
"No valid data in {}".format(sensor) if price_data is none and data == [] and valid_sensor,
"No valid data in provided price_data" if price_data is not none and not valid_price_data,
"Time key '{}' not found in data".format(time_key) if data and time_key not in data[0],
"Value key '{}' not found in data".format(value_key) if data and value_key not in data[0],
"Invalid mode '{}' selected".format(mode) if mode not in modes,
"Boolean input expected for include_today, '{}' can not be processed as a boolean".format(include_today) if include_today | bool("") is not boolean,
"Boolean input expected for include_tomorrow, '{}' can not be processed as a boolean".format(include_tomorrow) if include_tomorrow | bool("") is not boolean,
"Boolean input expected for look_ahead, '{}' can not be processed as a boolean".format(look_ahead) if look_ahead | bool("") is not boolean,
"Boolean input expected for lowest, '{}' can not be processed as a boolean".format(lowest) if lowest | bool("") is not boolean,
"Boolean input expected for latest_possible, '{}' can not be processed as a boolean".format(latest_possible) if latest_possible | bool("") is not boolean,
"Numeric input or percentage expected for price_tolerance, '{}' can not be processed as a float or percentage".format(price_tolerance) if not valid_pt,
"Numeric input expected for kwh, '{}' can not be processed as a float".format(kwh) if kwh is not none and not kwh | is_number,
"Selected program '{}' is not available or has no data".format(program) if program is not none and w is none,
"Selected start parameter is after the end parameter" if start_end and data,
"{} hours between start and end, where {} hours are required".format(end_start, h | round(3)) if not start_end and end_start < h | round(3) and data,
"Invalid combination of source data points per hour '{}' and number of weight points '{}'".format(dp, dph) if all_keys and not wp_check

name: Home Battery Strategy
info:
The `Home Battery Start` flow will call this strategy flow
by matching the strategy name with the Link In name.

Configure the Link In node in the Start group.

Don't modify other parts of the Start and End groups.

name: Integral term adjust
Bumpless Ki changes
info:
Recalc I-term whenever Ki changes

Note: always be mindful of making changes to control parameters of systems in operation.

name: Target grid consumption
info: Set at 0 to strive for zero consumption

name: Advanced settings
Set: Error signal
Bumpless target grid consumption
info:
The error value is used by default to calculate the derivative.
When the target grid consumption (tgc) is changed, the system is takes the derivative of the process variable instead.
This prevents irratic behavior during sudden changes of the error or setpoint value.

e.g. you change the setpoint from 0 to 100W 
The error would make an instantanious jump and cause a huge derivative-term.
The pv stays continous and fluent.

After 1 control tick the derivative is taken from error again.
Until the `tgc` is changed again.

name: Derivative PV
Derivative Error
Derivative final value
func: return msg;

name: Deadband (15W)
Calculate corrections
Output dampening
Output failsafe
on change
func: rbe
